documents.t: docu-notion lets you use Notion as your editor for markdown-based static site generators like Docusaurus. Using Notion instead of raw markdown files means that you don't have to teach non-developers how to make git commits and pull requests. It also allows you to leverage Notion's database tools to control workflow, Notion's commenting feature to discuss changes, etc. astuce Note that docu-notion is not a service that could be reading your data. docu-notion is just open-source code that will run on your computer or your CI system. info In Notion, notice that the slug of this page is a slash. This tells Docusaurus that this is the default document to show.

Normal paragraph with <breaking syntax> List item 1 is normal List item 2 has <syntax> which causes issues for the html parser (& what about : / \ [ ] { } ; “ ‘)?! See https://github.com/sillsdev/docu-notion/issues/21 What about a link with <angle brackets>?

This page is special in that it exists in the outline rather than the database where we prefer pages to live. It is here to demonstrate that docu-notion will still retrieve it. This is a raw link to the intro: Introduction to docu-notion This is a raw link to the fruits section: [Problem Internal Link] This is a link to Apples. This is a bare to google https://www.google.com/

Docusaurus has some nice custom callouts called “Admonitions”. remarque Note about something astuce Tip about something with an internal link. info Info about something attention A Caution about something danger Something dangerous ← should be bold :::🚧 A note about this being under construction :::

If docu-notion notices that you have embedded a video, it should convert that to code useable in Docusaurus by using react-player. YouTube example: docu-notion does the following when it detects an embedded link to a video: Adds import ReactPlayer from "react-player"; to the markdown Inserts html like <ReactPlayer controls url="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5M3nJrlf3p0&t=70s" /> info If your site is not based on docu-notion-sample-site, you may need to add ReactPlayer to your Docusaurus project: yarn add react-player or npm i react-player If docu-notion notices that you have embed a video it should convert that to code useable in Docusaurus by using react-player. Vimeo example: This one is a direct upload: A GIF:
(credit: Pixabay, license: free Pixabay license) Apples are better than oranges. Oranges
If you embed a gif in notion, it should be embedded in Docusaurus

When it detects an embedded gif, docu-notion does the following: Adds a import GifPlayer from "react-gif-player"; to the markdown. Inserts html like <GifPlayer gif="https://media.giphy.com/media/VhiAuDYHkNPydiNnOs/giphy.gif" /> info If your site is not based on docu-notion-sample-site, you may need to add react-gif-player to your Docusaurus project: yarn add react-gif-player or npm i react-gif-player

one two Some text in between three this is three aa four This is a bulleted list: alpha beta A todo item Another todo item (note, with Docusaurus 2, if you follow the above list with the below toggle without material in-between, you get https://github.com/sillsdev/docu-notion/issues/77) toggle me - inside bullet inside plain text This is a toggle The inside of a toggle This is an empty toggle
astuce A lightbulb callout attention A warning callout
There should be text on the left, and an apple on the right. A paragraph on the left. Another paragraph.

Though Docusaurus doesn’t allow linking to heading 1 within their system (see https://github.com/facebook/docusaurus/issues/5036), Notion does, and linking to a heading 1 still works through docu-notion if we just code it up the same way as the others. Link to a heading 2. Link to a heading 3.
head 1 head 2 who this what yeah that
Fruit Closed - Apple - Orange Fruit Open - Apple - Orange attention There is a report of serious problems with toggles: https://github.com/sillsdev/docu-notion/issues/77

This page is here to test what url we end up with when we have a character like “/” that has meaning in URLs. An example of a fruit is Apples are good
